intro:
Our actions are the recursive product of our older actions and of our passivity. Therefore every human is worth the same and everyone deserves to be happy.

I don't want to bring my ideas here, but it makes me think that capitalism is built on a lie.

I hope you're happy.

post.body: September the 25th, 2016, and I still wonder if my zeroid is hot or "domain" parking.

comment.body: Though some *decent* security is still good (and that's why I'm still interested in Qubes OS and TOR), I just want to make clear that you can't achieve NSA-proof without separate hardware: you'd need a Raspberry Pi 2/3 and one Raspberry Pi Zero to get real privacy; and separate hardware, both bought in cash (so one couldn't track you from your serial number), + a delayer (which means another Raspberry Pi Zero), so one couldn't track you from your keyboard fingerprint, to get real anonymity.

As I can't pay $200 to get all of that (and because some software needs to be done so it would transparently work), a Bitmessage instance in a Qubes OS container with a strong firewall (drops every input/output, save UDP and TCP 8444) is quite enough. Compiling Qubes OS by myself and having an open hardware processor would be good too.
Hello! Which projects are you involved in? What are your languages?
Why would I trust an encrypted ZeroNet chat site when I already have Freenet and Bitmessage?
